com.tversity.sdk.android
Interface IAFPlayer

All Superinterfaces:
IAFDevice
public interface IAFPlayer
extends IAFDevice

This interface provides access and control to player devices

play

void play(java.lang.String uri,
          java.lang.String title,
          java.lang.String mimeType,
          java.lang.Object userData,
          AirFlinger.ICommandCallback callback)
          throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
This method is used for sending a URI to the player with the instruction to play it

Parameters:
uri - The URI to play
title - Title of the media to play (some devices show this title when the media starts playing)
mimeType - The mime type of the media. If null is sent, the SDK will try to find the mime type using the media URI
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

play

void play(java.lang.String uri,
          java.lang.String title,
          java.lang.String mimeType,
          java.lang.Object userData,
          AirFlinger.ICommandCallback callback,
          AirFlinger.IPositionEventCallback posEventCallback)
          throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
This method is used for sending a URI to the player with the instruction to play it.

Note: If posEventCallback is specified, it will be invoked with the same userData that the command callback is invoked with. Therefore, the userData should not be released on command callback, rather the OnPlayerStopped method of this callback should be used for releasing the user data

Parameters:
uri - The URI to play
title - Title of the media to play (some devices show this title when the media starts playing)
mimeType - The mime type of the media. If null is sent, the SDK will try to find the mime type using the media URI
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command
posEventCallback - Optional - If not null and the media is video or audio, this callback will be invoked about every second with the current position information
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

stop

void stop(java.lang.Object userData,
          AirFlinger.ICommandCallback callback)
          throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
This method is used for sending a stop command to the player

Parameters:
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

seek

void seek(java.lang.String seekTime,
          java.lang.Object userData,
          AirFlinger.ICommandCallback callback)
          throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
This method is used for sending a seek command to the player to set a new current position

Parameters:
seekTime - The new position the player should seek to in the format HH:MM:SS
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException

seek

void seek(int seekSecs,
          java.lang.Object userData,
          AirFlinger.ICommandCallback callback)
          throws AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
This method is used for sending a seek command to the player to set a new current position

Parameters:
seekSecs - The new position the player should seek to in seconds form the beginning
userData - Optional - this data will be sent back on the callback function
callback - Callback function that will be invoked after the player has performed the command
Throws:
AirFlinger.AirFlingerException
